18.heading: Fathers.
18.title: The Man in the Pointed Hat
18.author: Cecil Fernando.
notes: (Shelter ; v. 2)
(ComicsLit)

Summary: "A woman writer decides to rest inside the cabin that imparts mystically strong powers of recollection. Soon enough, those powers make her face her childhood and repressed memories. To her surprise, she is suddenly a child again with her young parents. As she relives those days, her father begins to cut a fascinatingly mysterious yet strangely threatening profile" -back cover.

33.heading: Fathers.
33.title: "The Mystery of the Super-Batman!"
33.author: Craig Boldman, writer ; Alex Saviuk, penciller ; Karl Kesel, inker ; Ben Oda, letterer ; D'Angelo, colorist ; Julius Schwartz, editor
notes: Summary (by Mary Walker): Lana Lang reports on mysterious sightings of a 'super-Batman'. Kent calls Bruce Wayne and leaves a message with Alfred that he has a good reason for what he is doing and will explain later. He recalls how Lana had some Pan-pipes which her father found with a statue of the god and how he experienced an excruciating pain when she blew on them. Later he looks in the mirror and finds he has grown horns. He realizes that the syrinx, or pipes, may be the cure but he has to find them because they have been stolen. To hide what has happened he adopts Batman's cowl and cape in place of his own cape. He uses the horns to capture the superstitious thief before the spell dissipates taking the horns with them. He tells Bruce about the episode and asks, "How do you ever manage to scare anyone in that get-up of yours?"

50.heading: Fathers.
50.title: "Pesadilla"
50.author: argumento, Yolanda Vargas Dulché ; dibujo, Sixto Valencia
notes: SUMMARY: Isabel, the mother of Carlos, becomes very depressed when she learns that Carlos is missing out on some of the fun with his friends because they're so poor. She pretends to go out all night to a cabaret and come home drunk at dawn. This, she seems to be hoping, will convince Carlos to take his rich father's offer and move into the mansion. Carlos is beside himself to think his mother has gone back to her old profession, and pleads with her to continue doing laundry for people. She says they'll talk about it later, and that for now he should just get out of her way. Carlos goes to play baseball with his friends, and Memín can tell he's upset behind his smile. Memín hits a one-handed home run by imitating the tennis player Pelón Ozuna.

66.heading: Fathers.
66.title: Road to Perdition [videorecording]
66.author: Dreamworks Pictures and Twentieth Century Fox present a Zanuck Company production ; producers, Richard D
66.appears_in: Zanuck, Dean Zanuck, Sam Mendes ; screenplay writer, David Self ; director, Sam Mendes.
notes: 1 videocassette (117 min.) : sd., col. ; 1/2 in.
VHS.
Cast: Tom Hanks, Paul Newman, Jude Law, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Stanley Tucci, Daniel Craig, Tyler Hoechlin.
Originally produced as a motion picture in 2002.
Based on the graphic novel by Richard Piers Rayner and Max Allan Collins.

Summary (from OCLC): Michael Sullivan works as an enforcer for his adopted father, Irish gangster John Rooney. When Sullivan's son, Mike Jr., witnesses one of his father's killings on Rooney's behalf, the gangster decides that his ward and his family are liabilities that must be removed. Sullivan tries to safeguard his son and get even with the man who betrayed him, while his son focuses on bonding with his emotionally distant father.

93.title: "The Super-Cheat!"
93.author: [No author]
93.series: Supergirl) 12 p. in Action Comics, no. 319
notes: Begins: "You heard me! This is my father's"
Appearance of Shrinking Violet.

94.heading: Fathers.
94.title: "Take Mine"
94.author: by Brian Basset.
notes: Summary: Dad doesn't want to drive them to school after they missed their bus, and the kids don't have a driver's license.

95.heading: Fathers.
95.title: "Talk Some Sense Into Him!"
95.author: Lynn.
95.series: For Better or For Worse, Apr. 13, 1993
notes: Summary: Lawrence tries to reason with his mom about being gay, but she won't hear it and calls his father.

96.heading: Fathers.
96.title: "The Teeth of a Smoker"
96.author: by Ray Billingsley.
notes: Summary: In his campaign to make his dad quit smoking, Curtis shows his dad a photo from Brogan's Gym in which teeth look like corn kernels.

97.heading: Fathers.
97.title: "That Was Before Lawn Services Were Invented"
97.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi tells Chip how his father used to make him rake leaves.

98.heading: Fathers.
98.title: "That was the Opposing Team, Sammy"
98.author: [No author]
98.series: Lola, Nov. 13, 1999) by Steve Dickenson and Todd Clark.
notes: Summary: Sammy sees a picture of his dad being carried on the shoulders of football players.

99.heading: Fathers.
99.title: "That's Father"
99.author: [No author]
99.series: Jerry the Jitterbug) 1 p. in Wonder Woman, no. 96
notes: Begins: Isn't it a beautiful night for our first date?

100.heading: Fathers.
100.title: "That's My Pop!"
100.author: by R
100.appears_in: Crumb. 2 p. in Zap Comics, no. 6 (1973).
notes: Summary: Mr. Natural takes Flakey Foont to see his father; Mr. Natural's father calls Mr. Natural "Fred."

101.heading: Fathers.
101.title: "That's No Gag about th' Barefoot Kid with a Pinhook Ketchin' More Fish than the Expert!"
101.author: J
notes: (Why Mothers Get Gray).
Setting: A restaurant, where the son has ordered something that looks better than what the father has.

102.heading: Fathers.
102.title: "That's When They Sent Me Over Here"
102.author: Young & Drake
102.appears_in: p. 65 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Elmo asked his mother why she married his father, and it turned out she'd been wondering the same thing.

103.heading: Fathers.
103.title: "There Could be an Addition to Family Soon"
103.author: by Eric Olson and Susan Kelso.
notes: Summary: Daughter shows engagement ring given to her by young man with earring and peace symbol on jacket; open-mouthed father drops pipe.

104.heading: Fathers.
104.title: "There's No Women Up There"
104.author: Ray Helle.
notes: Summary: Both Butch and Dad want to go to the moon.

105.heading: Fathers.
105.title: "They're Lucky I Didn't Drop 'Em on the Hard Stone!"
105.author: J
notes: (Heroes are Made, Not Born)
Summary: Dad's arms are paralyzed from carrying heavy children.

106.heading: Fathers.
106.title: "This is John Darling Live on the Campus of Kent State University"
106.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
notes: Summary: Crankshaft sleeps through the news report on the Kent State disturbances; Pam was hoping her dad wouldn't see it.

107.heading: Fathers.
107.title: "The Stooges are Just Shakespeare with Fewer Syllables"
107.author: Michael Fry.
notes: Summary: A father passes down some wisdom.

108.heading: Fathers.
108.title: "Tight as a Noose" 10 p. in Zorro in Old California
108.author: by Nedaud [i
108.appears_in: e., Nadaud] and Marcello (Guerneville, Calif.: Eclipse Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Captain Monastario announces a toll of ten pesos to cross a bridge, and Zorro interferes with its collection. The city fathers meet to discuss this new outrage, and Monastario breaks up the meeting by arresting Don Alejandro (Zorro's father) for "endangering the security of the State." A gallows is set up to execute Don Alejandro, so Zorro and Bernardo have to act quickly. They spring Don Alejandro from the jail, then capture Captain Monastario and let him spend the night tied up, standing on the gallows with his head in the noose. The townspeople get a good laugh in the morning.

109.heading: Fathers.
109.title: "Too Bad For You, Dad. When You Were A Kid You Missed All This!"
109.author: by Mort Walker and Dik Browne
109.appears_in: p. 116 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: The twins are enjoying an old movie on television and talking about their favorite actors and actresses: Charlie Chaplin, Buster Keaton, Fred Astaire, Cary Grant, John Wayne, Greer Garson and Katharine Hepburn.

110.heading: Fathers.
110.title: "Tough Enough"
110.author: [No author]
110.series: Jughead) 1 p. in Jughead with Archie Digest Magazine, no. 131
notes: SUMMARY: Jughead asks his dad for help with his homework.

111.heading: Fathers.
111.title: "Unhappy as Hamlet"
111.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Amos suggests that his dad take a jaunt in his helicopter to get his mind off Miss Frankey, and dad suggests a fishing trip.
Unsigned.

112.heading: Fathers.
112.title: "Unpack, Dad, and Have a Cup of Tea"
112.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The elder Hoople begins his visit by handing Martha $100 "for steering my son Amos away from the men with the butterfly nets all these years."

113.heading: Fathers.
113.title: "Water Cure"
113.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Hilda's father plans an amphibious assault on the skirt patrol at his front window.

114.heading: Fathers.
114.title: "We Both Had a Good Day, Luke!"
114.author: Berrill.
notes: Summary: Luke scored two of Milford's touchdowns, and his dad just wants to talk about his birdie at golf.

115.heading: Fathers.
115.title: "We Could Almost Eat This"
115.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Dad's cooking is improving.

116.heading: Fathers.
116.title: "We Don't Have Time to Spend with a Puppy"
116.author: by Jack Elrod.
notes: Summary: Joseph and his dad talk about a horse with a bad temper, and Joseph starts to ask if he can have a puppy.

117.heading: Fathers.
117.title: "We Don't Spend Enough Time Together"
117.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake.
notes: Summary: Alexander wants to be with his dad, so Dagwood borrows a second lawmmower and they mow the yard together.

118.heading: Fathers.
118.title: "We Got Dragon Bones in Our Yard"
118.author: Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Priscilla overhears as Pop complains about Oliver dragging bones into the yard.

119.heading: Fathers.
119.title: "We Need a Hand-Truck, Son"
119.author: Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Joe's dad has arrived at the cookout "practically empty-handed".

120.heading: Fathers.
120.title: "We'll Order Pizzas Every Night and Rent Lassie Videos!"
120.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy's father promises to brush Electra every day while Cathy's gone.

121.heading: Fathers.
121.title: "Well, We Know You Can Handle Pressure"
121.author: Bill Hinds.
notes: Summary: Dawn's dad puts lights all over her so she'll be noticed during soccer tryouts.

122.heading: Fathers.
122.title: "Were There Wild Animals Chasing You?"
122.author: by Ray Billingsley.
notes: Summary: Dad's smoking ("another cancerette") in the house bothers Curtis, and Curtis is told to go back outside.

123.heading: Fathers.
123.title: "What a Coincidence, My Dad was a Boxer Too!"
123.author: Mike Peters.
notes: Summary: Grimmy is in the boxing ring with a pugilist.

124.heading: Fathers.
124.title: "What Are You, Some Kind of Martyr?"
124.author: Browne.
notes: Summary: Chip wonders why his dad always eats the heels of loaves of bread, crumbs of potato chips, "bruised apples, burned cookies, deformed pickles, cereal dust and leftovers."

125.heading: Fathers.
125.title: "What Do I Feed Her?"
125.author: Fagan.
notes: Summary: Dad tries to feed the Ginger, the dog, one of the baby ducks.

126.heading: Fathers.
126.title: "What If I Don't Get Older?"
126.author: Stantis & Greg.
notes: Summary: Eddie gets to go golfing with his dad.

127.heading: Fathers.
127.title: "When He Believed in Something, He Went For Broke!"
127.author: Paul Nichols, Harold LeDoux.
notes: Summary: David's father was a financial genius and a gambler who made and lost fortunes, but made a lot of money for his more conservative friends.

128.heading: Fathers.
128.title: "While Recuperating from a Wolf Bite, Andy Appreciates the Attention his New Friend is Giving Him"
128.author: by Jack Elrod.
notes: Summary: Joseph enjoys Andy's company, but doesn't dare let his dad see Andy.

129.heading: Fathers.
129.title: "Whistling Monkey Cowboy Band Land"
129.author: Kirkman & Scott.
notes: Summary: Dad greets proposed day trip with nothing that could be said in mixed company.
Key word: Amusement parks.

130.heading: Fathers.
130.title: "Who's Dad Going to Have Thanksgiving With?"
130.author: Bittle.
notes: Summary: Louis thinks his Dad won't have much to be thankful for by himself.

131.heading: Fathers.
131.title: "Why Are You Called Fast Freddy?"
131.author: Dik Browne
131.appears_in: p. 89 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Honi introduces a newcomer to her dad, and Freddy steals a smooch without Hagar noticing.

132.heading: Fathers.
132.title: "Why Don't You Throw It at the One Who Cooks It?"
132.author: Jim Unger.
notes: Summary: Dad has a bowl of food on his head.

133.heading: Fathers.
133.title: "Wind Chimes"
133.author: Curfman.
notes: Summary: Dad is pleased to loan his jazz CDs, anything but that "top-40 AM drivel."

134.heading: Fathers.
134.title: "With his Amazing ESP Power, Santiago Receives an Image when he Rubs the Old Pendant"
134.author: David Torrez
notes: Summary: Baltazar gives Santiago a pendant, and months later Santiago's father says it's linked to an "ancient sun cult."

135.heading: Fathers.
135.title: "The Witch Doctor's Reign of Terror"
135.author: art: Rudy Palais
135.appears_in: 8 p. in Rangers of Freedom Comics, no. 6 (Aug. 1942).
notes: Villain N'Gusi is introduced and dies; introduction of Aimee, and her father (who dies).
Data from Lou Mougin via The Grand Comics Database Project.

136.heading: Fathers.
136.title: "Wonder Girl's Mysterious Father"
136.author: [No author]
136.series: Wonder Girl) 13 p. in Wonder Woman, no. 152

137.heading: Fathers.
137.title: "Would I Be Too Big a Geek if I Went and Told Him I Was Proud of Him?"
137.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: Jason is amazed that his dad gave blood.

138.heading: Fathers.
138.title: "Wow. How Did You Finally Get Him to Mow the Lawn?"
138.author: Mark Parisi.
notes: Summary: Dad has made an arcade-style game of lawnmowing.

139.heading: Fathers.
139.title: "The Wrath of the Wild Finn Gang"
139.author: art: Sam Savitt
139.appears_in: 6 p. in Rangers of Freedom Comics, no. 7 (Oct. 1942).
notes: Villains the Wild Finn Gang are introduced; introduction of Mary, and her father (who dies).
Data from Lou Mougin via The Grand Comics Database Project.

140.heading: Fathers.
140.title: "Yes, Ask Father"
140.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard and Freckles feel like saps, and go to ask Freckles' dad how long it will take to become men and put women in their places; they find Pop unhappily wearing a dress while his wife pins the hem.

141.heading: Fathers.
141.title: "Yes, It's a Named Storm"
141.author: Dunagin.
notes: Key words: Vacation villas, hurricanes, fathers.

143.heading: Fathers.
143.title: "You Can't Fool Us, Dad. We Can Hear You Snoring"
143.author: Ketcham.
notes: Key words: Tool boxes, wrenches, cabinets, repairs, sleeping.

144.heading: Fathers.
144.title: "You Have No Idea What Goes Into the Preparation of One of My Dinners"
144.author: Lincoln Peirce.
notes: Summary: Nate complains about his dad's cooking, and suspects it's done in a cauldron with a witch's hat.

145.heading: Fathers.
145.title: "You Mean You're Going to be a Fourth Grade Dropout?"
145.author: by Dick Turner.
notes: Summary: The homework seems to have gotten to hard for Dad.

146.heading: Fathers.
146.title: "You'd Rather Eat a Couple Slices of Fast-Food Pizza than a Heaping Mountain of my Famous Scrambled Eggs?"
146.author: Amend.
notes: Summary: Paige wants to call Domino's, and assumes her father has asked her a trick question.

148.heading: Fathers.
148.title: "You're at the Bottom of the Food Chain"
148.author: by Johnny Hart.
notes: Summary: Elwood, a young ant, is off to seek his fortune, and his dad tells him to remember one thing.
Key word: Advice.
